verses.roman:
nityadā sarva-bhūtānāṁ
brahmādīnāṁ parantapa
utpatti-pralayāv eke
sūkṣma-jñāḥ sampracakṣate

synonyms: nityadā—constantly; sarva-bhūtānām—of all created beings; brahma-ādīnām—beginning with Lord Brahmā; param-tapa—O subduer of the enemies; utpatti—creation; pralayau—and annihilation; eke—some; sūkṣma-jñāḥ—expert knowers of subtle things; sampracakṣate—declare.
translation: Experts in the subtle workings of nature, O subduer of the enemy, have declared that there are continuous processes of creation and annihilation that all created beings, beginning with Brahmā, constantly undergo.
